content: Hi, I'm feeling really overwhelmed with my final year project.
I understand. Let's break it down. What's the biggest blocker?
I have to build a compiler but I keep procrastinating.
Also, I hate coding in Java. It's too verbose.
We can look for alternatives or wrappers. Have you tried Python?
Yeah, I love Python. I use it for all my backend scripts.
My professor, Dr. Smith, is very strict about deadlines though.
I usually code late at night, around 2 AM.
Late nights can be quiet, but make sure you sleep.
I'm trying. I also started jogging to clear my head.
I get anxious when I see a blank screen.
By the way, remind me to buy coffee beans from Blue Tokai.
I only drink dark roast.
My sister's wedding is coming up next month, so I'm distracted.
I need to finish the lexical analyzer by Friday.
I wish I could just play guitar instead of coding right now.
Do you think I should switch to Go for this project?
I'm worried I won't get a job after graduation in 2025.
I failed my first interview yesterday.
It makes me feel incompetent.
But I'm good at system design, I know that.
I need a plan to study for the next one.
I prefer learning through videos rather than books.
Can you explain how a parser works? Keep it simple.
I'm actually really excited about AI agents.
I want to build something like Jarvis eventually.
I live in Indore, so the tech scene isn't huge here.
Okay, enough venting. Let's get to work.
What is the first step for the parser?
Thanks for listening.
